title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: My interview was quick, clear, and precise. After a few words, the interviewer, (Professor of the course), asked questions about my ability to handle questions from students and my own ability in modeling.
Interview Questions: How much are you familiar with software?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was very straightforward. Involved a lot of behavioral questions about my past experience in project management and collaborating in teams. It was helpful to have networked with my current Director when I was in undergrad.
Interview Questions: How did you take advantage of study abroad opportunities when you were in undergrad?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: It was an amicable process that was not labor intensive. As long as the professor likes you, you'll do fine all in all. Doing well in the class previously helps of course.
Interview Questions: what did you like about the class?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straight forward. Met several department members and those that I would be working with. It was less interogation-based and more working alongside and conversations with them throughout the day. This would also vary heavily depending on the professor you would be researching with as they will each have their own style
Interview Questions: Please discuss some of your prior research and publications.

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: I applied via their website. The question process online was lengthy. Interview was scheduled the following week. 15 minute timely phone call. The interviewer was pleasant and asked standard questions. Was informative about the university's goals and mission. I
Interview Questions: What interested you in the position?

title: Front Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and straightforward. They stated what they expected of the position and I told them my schedule to avoid potential conflicts. Since it was on campus I was able to get to the front desk in a short amount of time. I felt like I was prepared for the interview because I looked online at the website and read the description beforehand.
Interview Questions: What are your available hours?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: Long process with a lot of people. But overall a good experience learning about the job and people who you would be potentially working with. I felt a lot of transparency throughout the interview experience.
Interview Questions: Experience questions, salary questions,  etc. Standard.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions about who you are and why you want the job. It is quite easy as long as come prepared to explain what you can do. Don't sweat it, it's not that serious
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Event Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: Met with multiple members of the staff, all very friendly and kind. Answered a wide variety of questions pertaining to my experience and skills. Was given an opportunity to ask as many questions as I wanted.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a situation where no matter the decision you make, one involved party will be angry or upset with your choice?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted within a few days of the closing date for an interview with a large hiring committee of administrators, students, and faculty, who each asked one question. I was surprised by the fast pace of the search, which was concluded within a couple weeks of the closing date.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work at Lehigh

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was asked both general questions typical of any interview (eg.  tell us about your self) as well as specific strategy related questions (eg. how can we use social media to recruit more international students).
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself, why should we hire you, etc

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: On-site interview that talks about the past experience and introduce the main responsibilities of this job.  No preparation needed. It is no very professional, it is more like a casual talking.
Interview Questions: Your flexibility.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: Not a bad interview process since it is more of an entry level position. I had one phone interview then one in person interview for about an hour with 3 people during that interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working at Lehigh?

title: Lehigh Liner Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone  interview with a current employee interviewing us and asking us about why we chose to apply to the job and our skill sets and doing a mock interview of how we would be during an actual phone call.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with an alumni angry about a something happening on campus?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview, one face to face interview.  Interviewer was typing notes into computer during responses for both interviews, leaving me to wonder if he was really paying attention to all I was saying.  Was told all applicants would hear back the next week, one way or the other, but did not hear back for over a month.
Interview Questions: What would you rather kill, a duck the size of a horse, or 100 horses the size of a duck?

title: Ticket Sales Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: They asked me about my strengths and why I believe I would be a good fit for the role. It was very informal, almost like a conversation at one point.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths?
What are your weaknesses?
How well do you work in teams?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: 1 phone interview and one all day interview on campus where I met with all of the people in the department and did a campus tour. The interview ended with a presentation to the department about my ideas I would bring to the position.
Interview Questions: What ideas do you have to bring to the position

title: Stage Hand Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: Very casual and inclusive of all experience levels. This position works on a team of outside stagehands and some student workers. The Zoellner Arts Center hosts many events, and it is great to prepare for a variety of work.
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself on a team?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lehigh University in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview followed by campus visit.  I did not make it past the Skype interview. I applied online and then received a call to schedule the Skype interview.
Interview Questions: Name one time you had to collaborate with people from a different department and how you managed everyone's expectations.

title: Senior Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the hiring manager before onsite interview. The onsite interview was almost  whole day, including different sessions of panel interview with different groups and  a couple of one on one sessions. There was a short preseason with Q & A,  the topic was provided before the interview. Lunch with a group and a campus tour at noon. It was a quite nice process.
Interview Questions: general behavioral interview questions and technical questions

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lehigh University in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Web-based interview with 5 or 6 current faculty.   Very slow to confirm the initial interview and over 3 months passed before a decision was made (which was mentioned during the interview that it would be months before they made a final decision).
Interview Questions: What is your favorite Learning Theory?

title: Senior Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with hiring committee was followed by an invitation to an all-day in-person interview, tour and lunch. Was asked to prepare a 20-minute presentation on a specific topic of their choosing which required a lot of time and effort to prepare. There were a few "light" technical questions but most of the concerns seemed to be about fitting in with the culture. A specialist provided an overview of benefits.
Interview Questions: What IDE do you use?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was enrolled as a graduate student in the Department of Mathematics and I was designated as a grader in the first year. Since my grade was good and I had a good work on my grader position, I was able to be designated as a teaching assistant in my second year.
Interview Questions: is the stipend ok for you?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was comfortable, relaxed, enthusiastic. The interviewers were the department coordinators that were to be worked with directly. The department had a very lax environment for the entire interview and interview process. The process was a short process, only a few days. The interviewer was late to the time scheduled.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest failure?

title: Engineering Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Lehigh, PA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The on campus selection process is a bit tedious as mostly seniors have projects. You have to keep on applying and meeting mentors, try to enhance skills. Once the mentors believe that you are ready for a project they will select you.
Interview Questions: Do you have a car?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: First you need a recommendation from the professor that relates to the subject you want to tutor and then have an interview with the director of the office of academic success. First the director will start up with why you want to do tutoring and more behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: What kind of problems you can expect that may help during tutoring?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was Informal. I was asked some questions over email about projects I completed over my college career. The interview informed about what he would like me to work on over the summer and what he would like done. Basically checked to see if I was a good fit for an intern position.
Interview Questions: Just asked question about what I accomplished in my college career.

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: no interview just talk to the professor and get a job, really simple, there is no process, just need someone to grade the homework, and the professor is new
Interview Questions: your availability during a week

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Very easy interview, straight forward questions. I do not think that anyone should have an issue interviewing at a university; the questions are easy and they are laidback.  If you are used to working in industry then you are a shoe-in for simple positions like GA positions at Lehigh
I would suggest being ultra nice and attentive during an interview; they can pick up on this sort of thing because they are all people persons and you have to come across the same way to fit in.
Interview Questions: How many times do you deal with customers in your position?

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It is very easy. Just walk in, and wait supervisor prepare her documents. Then ask some questions, like your time Schelde, if you can take 50 heavy goods and so on.
Interview Questions: if you can take 50 heavy goods

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: Resume selection， Submit the letter of interest. The faculty will reach in person to set up an Interview. The Interview will be probably 20-30minutes, mainly discuss about the projects of the professor and what the work would be like. Also, go over your resume.
Interview Questions: Technical Questions. Show the analysis of the data process in person and try come up with a ideal result

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Rigorous with multiple people weighing in. Met on 1 day for an initial interview and was invited back for a round of multiple interviews. 4 people made it to the second round and offers were mailed within 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very coming. The panel was very experienced and fun to talk to. Easy going and very flexible. I knew from the time I left the interview that it was the company I wanted work for.
Interview Questions: Tell me about when you faced an unexpected project outcome

title: Development Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Jobs are posted on the Jobs at Lehigh site. Anyone interested in a job should follow the directions given on the site. A cover letter is crucial. Don't skip this! Also be very accurate with details...spelling, grammar, etc. Hiring managers then read over the potential candidate applications and choose the best fits for the open position. An interview with the hiring manager will be set up for those that meet the qualifications of the job. An auxiliary interview may also take place with the staff with whom the candidate will be working. As the candidates are narrowed down, those that pass the first hurdles will then interview with managers who are higher up on the scale. The process can be intimidating, as most interviews can be. In all, it can take up to 6 weeks or so to finally bring in the 'winning' candidate!
Interview Questions: "Tell me about yourself". This question is always difficult, so be very careful and deliberate how it is answered! Keep it relevant!

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is slow and candidates are closely weighed against the competition. There is a large focus on research and publishing often gives an advantage. In this university, personal contacts are extremely important and, while it is possible to get in cold, a contact will greatly increase your chances.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the department?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: First get a phone call, the phone interview. Asked if I have the exoerience if some specific instrument. After 3 or 4 days, got the email inviting me to his lab to make a presentation and discussed the position reponsibilities. I got some difficult questions and that really caught me. I just be honest. Then talked to all lab members .
Interview Questions: Detail of my experiment and calculation part. Some aspect that I did not pay attention to.

title: Phone Caller Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lehigh University
Interview Descriptions: Email and phone interview
Interview Questions: Not really any tough interview questions. After entering the program you would have to face rigorous courses qualifier exams general exams and the dissertation.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA)
Interview Descriptions: They give you six or eight half-hour meetings with professors and a lunch with other graduate students. The professors may not know you are meeting with them and the students may talk about video games.
Interview Questions: One professor was asleep when I arrived at his office.

title: Assistant Director of Career Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Many behavioral type questions. In one day and about 5 hours... One-on-one interview with director of career services, Group interview: they went around the panel and about 10 people asked a question each, and finally one-on-one interview with the VP
Interview Questions: Many, MANY behavioral questions

title: Student Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was recruited by the Managing Director of the Enterprise Systems Center for the Student Consultant position. I interviewed with the Managing Director and a Project Manager, who I worked closely with throughout my project experience. The hiring process was completed with ease following a very straightforward interview process. The interview was conducted at a conversational pace and questions focused on resume and personality responses.
Interview Questions: Where will you be in five years?

title: Event Planner Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: 1. Went to Job Fair. 2. Picked up a flyer for the Women's Center.  3. Applied 4. Went in to the Center for an interview with the director. 5. Accepted job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the women's center?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethel, CT) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: interviewed 2 days including  a group meeting with search committee members and other individual 1-1 meetings with faculty members. Had a research presentation and a teaching presentation. People were very nice and try to make me comfortable, but some faculty members asked me very technical questions about my research topic.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lehigh University (Bethlehem, PA) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: First you have to apply online for the position. You need to upload your cover letter and you cv. For the interview they will ask you about your availability  and then they will propose several options for the time. In the interview process they basically want to know how good of a match are your interest with the current research topics going on in the department you are applying.
Interview Questions: What is your plan for research in the next two years?
